channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MA

item.title: Report E-2023120178
item.description:
Report E-2023120178

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-30
  • City: CHICOPEE
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one case of printing ink (UN1210) had been damaged by a sharp object and that 3 of the inner poly 1 quart bottles had been damaged and had released 1 quart of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023110790
item.description:
Report X-2023110790

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-06
  • City: NORTH BILLERICA
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PKG WAS BEING UNLOADED FROM TRAILER. WHEN DISCOVERED BOTTOM OF BOX WAS WET WITH SUBSTANCE. WHEN OPENED FOUND BOTTLE WITH PLASTIC BAG WRAPPED AROUND IT. THERE WAS LIQUID INSIDE BAG. LEAKAGE COMING FROM UNDER CAP. CAP ITSELF WAS TIGHT BUT STILL LEAKING. PLACED IN A RED HAZMAT BIN AND PLACED IN QA. DescribePack: LEAKAGE FROM UNDER CAP. BLUE SEAL UNDER CAP LEAKING LIQUID DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED UPRIGHT IN A HAZMAT BIN

item.title: Report X-2023110737
item.description:
Report X-2023110737

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-03
  • City: MIDDLEBORO
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazmat was found in the belly of trailer 824814 from Hartford during the preload. QA was notified and examined the package. The release from the hazmat was self contained and only affected the packaging of the hazmat itself. No release entered the trailer or contaminated other packages. The hazmat package was then removed from the trailer and brought to QA repack for processing. DescribePack: The cap on one of the bottles was loose causing roughly 2oz of the liquid to spill inside of the box. The face of the box closest to the spill became wet and ripped from the damage. It also became stained. The rip was at the top left of the face of the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was removed and kept away from other boxes to prevent any potential additional spillage from causing damage. After DPR was processed caps were tightened on all bottles to prevent further spillage.
